author: @nypmetro
title: Faithful flock to St. Patrick's Cathedral to pray for Pope Francis in battle with double pneumonia
text:
Faithful flock to St. Patrick‚Äôs Cathedral to pray for Pope Francis in battle with double pneumonia
Hundreds gathered for Sunday mass at New York City‚Äôs St. Patrick‚Äôs Cathedral to pray for Pope Francis, who remains in critical condition after he was diagnosed with double pneumonia.
Cardinal Timothy Dolan, archbishop of New York, relayed the pontiff and Vatican‚Äôs message that the pope was ‚Äúresting comfortably‚Äù as he reminded the worried worshipers that Francis has a history with health issues that he has overcome to lead the Catholic Church.
‚ÄúHe keeps the grit and determination, the resilience, and he‚Äôs really taught us‚Ä¶ the transformative redemptive value of suffering,‚Äù Dolan said.
‚ÄúToday at least they say he‚Äôs resting comfortably, it‚Äôs kind of good to know that he‚Äôs not suffering,‚Äù he added.
The pope was admitted to Rome‚Äôs Gemelli hospital on Feb. 14 after experiencing difficulty breathing for several days, with doctors diagnosing him with pneumonia in both lungs.
The Vatican said his condition was critical for the first time on Saturday, with the pontiff needing supplemental oxygen and blood transfusions following a ‚Äúprolonged asthma-like respiratory crisis.‚Äù
Lifelong New Yorker and philanthropist Barbara Zucker, 87, said she came down to St. Patrick‚Äôs to pray for the pope, joined by her husband Donald, who is Jewish.
‚ÄúI just don‚Äôt want to lose him because he‚Äôs been very special,‚Äù Zucker told The Post.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm hoping that when they do have a conclave because he‚Äôs pretty sick, that they‚Äôll have somebody as good as him, and maybe better. He cares about everyone,‚Äù she said of the ailing pontiff.
Dawn Cortese, 56, of Bergen County, New Jersey, said she made the trek to Manhattan with a friend to show solidarity with Francis, who she said serves as the best representative of the Catholic Church.
‚ÄúI just hope that he recovers and that he‚Äôs not in any pain, and I‚Äôm praying for him,‚Äù she said.
Fellow Garden State resident Louis Vacca, 78, said he was upset to hear the news of Francis‚Äô health.
‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the father of the church. So we believe in him and God,‚Äù Vacca said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre praying, we‚Äôre praying for him.‚Äù
Dolan, who was part of the conclave that elected Francis to the role of pope in 2013, said he too was worried about pontiff‚Äôs health as he reminisced about their meeting in 2015.
‚ÄúHe was kind of mesmerized by the size of [New York City], and he was very, very moved by the enthusiasm of the welcome we gave,‚Äù Dolan said of Francis‚Äô visit to the Big Apple.
‚ÄúI‚Äôve gotten to know him, so I worry about him as I would as I would my own father, because he is our holy father,‚Äù the archbishop added
Double pneumonia is a serious infection that can inflame and scar both lungs, making it difficult to breathe. Francis is particularly prone to lung infections after he developed pleurisy as a young adult and had part of one lung removed.

author: Annie Coyne
title: Crafting Engaging Email Copy: Do‚Äôs and Don‚Äôts - TechTarget
text:
Welcome to the last installment of our three-part blog series, in which we explore how to strengthen your email marketing efforts. In parts one and two, we presented tips for creating subject lines and standout calls to action (CTAs). Now, we‚Äôre going to dive into strategies for developing email copy that will engage your readers: IT business professionals. As a marketing copywriter, I write emails for this audience every day. The following tips are informed by my experiences and those of my colleagues.
Before we delve into those tips, we must first consider the factors that make engaging IT professionals through email challenging. Along with being extremely busy, IT pros tend to be risk averse : they prioritize avoiding issues over seeking out unfamiliar opportunities. Given the many obstacles facing IT pros ‚Äì straining budgets or proliferating threats, for example ‚Äì their aversion to risk is perfectly understandable. But unfortunately, it does not work in your favor. So, how can you engage the seemingly un-engageable?
Tip #1: Provide insights about topics that matter to your audience (technical challenges, market changes, upcoming deadlines, etc.) in a direct, brief manner that avoids frills. IT workers, like all professionals, need relevant, timely and enlightening information about their field, but they don‚Äôt have the time or interest to read through dense emails or ones that read like creative writing assignments. As you write an email, get to your point quickly and save your fiction-like prose for other writing endeavors. What other strategies should you keep in mind as you write? Let‚Äôs take a look at the experience of a network engineer, Pamela, to find out.
Having five minutes before her next meeting begins, Pamela decides to check her inbox. When she clicks on the first of nine unread emails from various security vendors, she is confronted by a wall of text: a single paragraph that‚Äôs seven, eight or maybe nine lines long. She doesn‚Äôt pause to count; instead, she swiftly deletes the email.
This brings us to . . .
Tip #2: Space out your copy instead of using large chunks of text to convey your insights. Yes, your insights are meaningful ‚Äì but so is the format in which you package them. If information is packaged in a daunting, overwhelming way, readers ‚Äì especially readers as busy as IT pros like Pamela ‚Äì will avoid investing their time to slog through. Luckily, there‚Äôs an easy, alternative approach to formatting copy: space it out. Simply break a seven-line paragraph into two or three shorter ones, creating a more digestible reading experience that also visually drives momentum to your call to action. Now, let‚Äôs turn our attention toward messaging.
When you email IT pros, you have a goal, whether that is to educate them about a topic, promote a product or have them download a report. This goal should be at the forefront of your mind as you craft your copy ‚Äì it isn‚Äôt something you should stray far from as you write.
Tip #3: Ensure that every sentence in your copy supports your goal. Because someone like Pamela receives so many emails, having a clear, focused purpose is not enough to set your email apart from the rest in her inbox. Along with supplying a focused message, it is also your job to convey the unique-ness of your insights, and how those insights can address her needs. But how can you do that?
Tip #4: Specificity is your friend ‚Äì don‚Äôt rely on overly general statements. You can supply your messaging with specificity by dialing into the details of the topic that your email concerns. To understand the power of specificity, let‚Äôs first take a look at the weakness of generality. Here‚Äôs an example of copy that is too general and high-level for a targeted security audience:
‚ÄúKeeping data safe is an increasing priority for businesses of all sizes, as ransomware is on the rise and poses a significant threat to your organization.‚Äù
On a macro-level, readers are astutely aware of the increasing rise in ransomware attacks, making the statement obvious and unhelpful. To move from general to specific, we can home in on striking details regarding the upward trend. For example, we can answer key questions like: Which businesses are being affected ‚Äì and how? What lessons do the ramifications reveal?
A revision, which narrows its focus on the 2023 Telus Canadian Ransomware Study , reads:
‚ÄúAccording to the 2023 Telus Canadian Ransomware Study, 67% of Canadian organizations experienced a ransomware incident last year. This trend showcases that identifying and detecting network vulnerabilities that ransomware could exploit is of paramount importance ‚Äì yet is difficult to achieve across hybrid cloud networks.‚Äù
In addition to highlighting the credibility and force that specificity lends, the above example showcases a maneuver that supports the mission of specificity. That maneuver is . . .
Tip #5: Leverage analysts‚Äô relevant, eye-catching statistics. Here are a few other examples, based on real lead generation promotional copy, written by myself and my colleagues:
17% of organizations report that their approach to security hygiene and posture management (SHPM) is completely decentralized, while 41% consider their approach to be only partially centralized, according to research by . analysts‚Äô 2023 research data showcases that 75% of organizations experienced multiple account or credential compromises over the last 12 months. To understand the benefits that a strong identity-security strategy can deliver, surveyed 1,500 security, IT and DevSecOps decision-makers. So, we‚Äôve covered the do‚Äôs and don‚Äôts of crafting email copy that will engage IT pros, insights which can be boiled down to five key tips. Keep these recommendations in mind as you craft your next email. And for additional guidance for strengthening your email marketing strategy, explore the rest of our blog series and this post about why, and how to harness intent data to inform your outreach.

author: Redacci√≥n Tendencias
title: Presentadora sufre par√°lisis facial en vivo y dice entre l√°grimas: "No puedo hablar"
text:
El video en el que la reconocida presentadora Pamela D√≠az sufri√≥ una par√°lisis en pleno programa en vivo se volvi√≥ r√°pidamente viral.
La televisi√≥n chilena vivi√≥ un momento de gran tensi√≥n el mi√©rcoles 19 de febrero, cuando la reconocida presentadora Pamela D√≠az, popularmente conocida como ‚ÄòLa Fiera‚Äô, sufri√≥ un delicado episodio de salud en plena transmisi√≥n en vivo del programa ‚ÄòHay que decirlo‚Äô en Canal 13.
Mientras se preparaba para realizar una menci√≥n comercial, D√≠az comenz√≥ a experimentar un s√≠ntoma inesperado: perdi√≥ el control de una parte de su labio y not√≥ dificultades para hablar. La incomodidad se hizo evidente tanto para ella como para sus compa√±eros en el set, quienes de inmediato notaron algo extra√±o en su rostro.
‚ÄúHace mucho tiempo que no me sent√≠a tan consciente de lo que yo soy‚Äù, coment√≥ D√≠az en un video publicado en su cuenta de Instagram. Aunque intent√≥ restarle importancia al percance, la preocupaci√≥n creci√≥ cuando su compa√±ero Nacho Guti√©rrez le sugiri√≥ detenerse. ‚ÄúLe dije: ‚Äòcabez√≥n, m√≠rame, ¬øqu√© tengo?‚Äô. Me vio y me dijo: ‚ÄòSe te va el labio un poco. √Åndate al tiro porque esto puede ser peligroso‚Äô‚Äù, relat√≥ la presentadora. Lea tambi√©n: Shakira en Colombia: las exigencias de la artista que nadie esperaba
A pesar de la advertencia, Pamela inicialmente se mostr√≥ reacia a abandonar la transmisi√≥n, insistiendo en terminar la menci√≥n antes de dirigirse a la cl√≠nica. Sin embargo, el malestar fue aumentando, y cuando la producci√≥n le pidi√≥ sonre√≠r frente a c√°mara, la situaci√≥n se hizo evidente: su rostro mostraba signos claros de una par√°lisis facial.
Este fue el diagn√≥stico de la presentadora Pamela D√≠az
Tras ser llevada de urgencia a un centro m√©dico, a D√≠az se le diagnostic√≥ una par√°lisis facial leve, probablemente causada por estr√©s, seg√∫n informaron los m√©dicos. Este trastorno, conocido m√©dicamente como par√°lisis de Bell, afecta los nervios faciales y suele manifestarse con debilidad muscular en un lado de la cara, dificultad para hablar o tragar, y en algunos casos, p√©rdida de la capacidad de cerrar un ojo.
La propia D√≠az confirm√≥ que, d√≠as antes del incidente, hab√≠a sentido un hormigueo en los labios, aunque no le dio importancia en su momento. ‚ÄúQued√© rara. Dije: ‚ÄòEsto no es tan normal, no puedo hablar bien‚Äô‚Äù, coment√≥ en sus redes sociales. Los s√≠ntomas, aunque leves, fueron lo suficientemente alarmantes para que los m√©dicos recomendaran reposo y manejo del estr√©s como tratamiento inicial.
Ya fuera de peligro, ‚ÄòLa Fiera‚Äô reapareci√≥ en redes sociales para tranquilizar a sus seguidores y reflexionar sobre la importancia de escuchar las se√±ales del cuerpo. ‚ÄúNo se preocupen, estoy bien. S√© que es un tema que parece que ha pasado a mucha gente. No s√© si esto es viral o si de verdad es estr√©s‚Äù, afirm√≥. Le puede interesar: Shaira dice que se sinti√≥ acosada por Jhonier Leal y expone sus comentarios sobre ella
¬øQu√© es la par√°lisis de Bell?
La par√°lisis facial, o par√°lisis de Bell, es un trastorno neurol√≥gico que causa debilidad o par√°lisis repentina de los m√∫sculos en un lado de la cara. Aunque sus causas exactas no siempre son claras, puede estar relacionada con infecciones virales, estr√©s extremo o trastornos autoinmunes.
De acuerdo con la Cl√≠nica Mayo, los s√≠ntomas pueden incluir:
Publicidad
- Dificultad para sonre√≠r o fruncir el ce√±o.
- Ca√≠da de un lado de la cara.
- Problemas para cerrar un ojo o comer.
Publicidad
- Sensibilidad al sonido en un o√≠do o p√©rdida parcial del gusto.
En la mayor√≠a de los casos, el pron√≥stico es positivo, y las personas afectadas suelen recuperarse completamente en cuesti√≥n de semanas o meses con el tratamiento adecuado, que puede incluir medicamentos antiinflamatorios, terapia f√≠sica y manejo del estr√©s.
[@el13cl]Un percance m√©dico que ocurri√≥ en vivo: Pamela D√≠az sufri√≥ una par√°lisis facial en plena emisi√≥n del programa Hay que decirlo. En TuD√≠a hablamos sobre el incidente que oblig√≥ a la comunicadora a dejar el espacio que anima con @nachogutierrezcastillo. tudia13 ‚òÄÔ∏ède LUNES A VIERNES desde las 8:00 horas por las pantallas de Canal13 y www.13.cl üíªüñ•Ô∏èüì±
[‚ô¨ original sound - el13cl - el13cl]

author: Bailey Moreton
title: Head torch saved fallen walker's life as rescuers fight 'atrocious' whiteout weather on An Cabar
text:
Highlands & Islands Head torch saved fallen walker‚Äôs life as rescuers fight ‚Äòatrocious‚Äô whiteout weather on An Cabar Rescuers and a helicopter team were forced to withdraw at points during the rescue due to the harsh conditions.
By Bailey Moreton January 1 2024, 1.40pm Share Head torch saved fallen walker‚Äôs life as rescuers fight ‚Äòatrocious‚Äô whiteout weather on An Cabar Share via Facebook Twitter Whatsapp Messenger Linkedin Email Post link https://www.pressandjournal.co.uk/fp/news/highlands-islands/6313425/head-torch-saved-fallen-walkers-life-as-rescuers-fight-atrocious-whiteout-weather-on-an-cabar/ Copy Link 0 comment Dundonnell Mountain Rescue Team rescued a fallen walker off An Cabar on Saturday. Image: Dundonnell Mountain Rescue Team
Dundonnell Mountain Rescue Team battled through‚Äùatrocious‚Äù whiteout conditions to save a woman on An Cabar.
The fallen walker slid off the hillside near the summit of the hill, near Ben Wyvis. After failing to make her way back up the steep slope, she phoned the police who alerted Dundonnell MRT around midday on Saturday.
Rescuers were deployed, along with two dogs from Search & Rescue Dog Association Scotland.
The teams headed out as the weather started to worsen on Saturday . In all they spent nearly 16 hours on the hill.
Speaking with the Press & Journal, team leader Iain Nesbitt said: ‚ÄúShe was extremely lucky. We were extremely lucky that we got a break in the weather.
‚ÄúI‚Äôve been on the rescue team for 20-odd years now and that‚Äôs probably one of the very few times where I have been out where the weather conditions were absolutely atrocious.‚Äù
The rescue was complicated by challenging weather conditions over the weekend. Image: Dundonnell Mountain Rescue Team Challenging rescue with windy, wintry conditions on An Cabar Teams initially searched around the walker‚Äôs last known position, but that proved fruitless.
As whiteout conditions set in, the rescuers had to withdraw and regroup.
Once the weather cleared slightly, the rescuers headed to Beallach Mor to search again. After around an hour, they heard shouting and saw the light from a headtorch.
From there rescuers were able to reach the woman, wrapping her in a blizzard survival jacket and giving her something warm to drink and some food.
Dundonnell MRT team leader Iain Nesbitt said: ‚ÄúCarrying a head torch has definitely saved her life.‚Äù
Rescue 151 arrived but then had to withdraw as the winds were too strong. Considering the conditions and where the walker was found, the rescuers determined they had to belay the person further up the mountain.
The rescued person was airlifted at around 2am on December 31. Image: Dundonnell Mountain Rescue Team After pulling her up three belays of 100-metres or so, the team reached the ridge. From there it was easier walking, according to Iain Nesbitt. The team led the woman down the path to a sheltered point. From there they stretchered her down to flatter ground.
Once there, the Rescue 151 team was able to airlift the walker to hospital at around 2am on December 31.
Mr Nesbitt added: ‚ÄúI have full respect for my teammates who did a fantastic job in very difficult circumstances.‚Äù
Wintry conditions mean busy weekend for MRTs The cold and harsh conditions that closed out 2023 for some areas meant it was a busy end to the year for other mountain rescue teams too. The Met Office had issued a yellow rain and snow warning for the area for most of Saturday.
A stranded climber was stretchered a mile down a mountain by Cairngorm Mountain Rescue in -2C snow blizzards on December 30.
Several mountain rescue teams had busy end to 2023. Image: Dundonnell Mountain Rescue Team The woman became separated from others in her party near Coire an t-Sneachda, with the full mountain rescue team dispatched at around 5.30pm.
Further south, Braemar Mountain Rescue was part of a search for two stranded people on Glen Tilt, late on December 28. Tayside Mountain Rescue Team was able to find them safely and lead them to safety.
Cairngorms climber lucky to be alive after being rescued during -2C snow blizzards and yellow weather warning

author: Ed Morrissey
title: Let's Face It -- DeSantis Faces a Hard Reality in Iowa ‚Äì HotAir
text: Look, maybe that much-touted door-knocking effort by Never Back Down will have some effect. But if it was building up support for DeSantis, don‚Äôt you think we would see at least some sign of growing DeSantis support in some recent poll? Actually, as bad as DeSantis‚Äôs numbers are, in most surveys he‚Äôs actually improving. In the Fox Business poll, DeSantis increased from 15 percent in September to 18 percent in December. In the Emerson poll, DeSantis increased from 14 percent in September to 15 percent in December. In CBS News‚Äô, DeSantis increased from 21 percent in September to 22 percent in December. In the Iowa State/Civiqs survey, DeSantis remained flat at 17 percent from October to December, and in the Des Moines Register poll, DeSantis increased from 16 percent to 19 percent. ‚Ä¶ I see a lot to like in DeSantis. But that doesn‚Äôt mean I‚Äôm blind to his flaws or in denial about how much of an underdog he is right now, or how high the climb ahead of him is. You folks do know that just because I‚Äôm telling you something doesn‚Äôt mean I like it, right? Have you run into so many people who only report the narrative that they prefer that you‚Äôve forgotten that human beings are capable of reporting what‚Äôs actually happening, whether or not it‚Äôs what they want to report? [Jim‚Äôs right, and I‚Äôm the one who argued that early polls would miss the big organizing effort in Iowa. They still may be missing a turnout phenomenon, but one would expect to see some evidence of that in polling with less than three weeks to go to the caucuses. DeSantis could still pull off a surprise, but at the very least, we‚Äôre not seeing much direct evidence of it. And the indirect evidence, including the churn in DeSantis‚Äô campaign and super-PAC leadership, suggests against the likelihood of success. ‚Äî Ed]

author: felicie.
title: In Assemblea la LFI non riesce a ottenere un voto sull'abrogazione della riforma delle pensioni
text:
NARRAZIONE ‚Äì L'ostruzione della ‚Äúbase comune‚Äù ha rallentato i dibattiti condotti dalla LFI nel quadro della sua ‚Äúnicchia‚Äù parlamentare, che si √® conclusa gioved√¨ sera a mezzanotte.
Come un passo indietro nel tempo. Questo gioved√¨ gli stessi attori hanno ripreso gli stessi dibattiti con gli stessi argomenti. Per tutto il giorno si √® discusso, in una vera e propria guerra di trincea, dell'abrogazione della riforma delle pensioni attuata ormai un anno e mezzo fa da √âlisabeth Borne. In occasione della nicchia parlamentare della [France](/tag/France) insoumise, macronisti e melenchonisti si sono battuti accanitamente, come nel febbraio 2023, attorno al contestato rinvio dell‚Äôet√† pensionabile, senza che la legge potesse essere votata, al termine di una giornata che si √® conclusa Gioved√¨ sera a mezzanotte, segnata da forti tensioni in emiciclo.
Leggi anche
Minacce, voci, palle puzzolenti: guerra di nervi tra deputati prima dell'esame dell'abrogazione della riforma delle pensioni
Questa volta i ruoli erano completamente invertiti. I deputati della LFI, guidati dal loro relatore Ugo Bernalicis, miravano a far adottare la loro proposta di legge per abrogare le riforme del Borne e della Touraine. E i macronisti, aiutati dalla destra LR, miravano a rallentare le discussioni per impedire il voto. Con, come spettatori silenziosi, RN e deputati socialisti che guardano passare i proiettili. ¬´ E' tutto una merda questo giorno. Francamente‚Ä¶
